TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name/click the continue button to start the experiment.
A 10ml pipette is taken from the pipette rack and is inserted into the pipette pump.
The cap of the PBS Buffer bottle is opened and pipette out 10ml of the buffer. Close the bottle.
The centrifuge tube labeled as IgG Antibody is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and 10ml of the PBS buffer is added to the tube.
The tube containing PBS buffer is placed back on the rack.
A butter paper is taken from the lab table.
The butter paper is placed on the weighing balance(g) and it is tared.
The cap of the IgG Antibody bottle is opened and a little amount of antibody is taken using a spatula.
The antibody is added to the butter placed on the weighing balance. 0.2g of antibody is weighed.
The tube containing PBS buffer is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and the IgG Antibody is added into it.
The tube containing antibody in PBS buffer is placed back on the rack.
DIALYSIS.
A forceps is taken from the lab table.
A small piece of dialysis tubing is taken from the Ethanol Storage Solution using the forceps.
The dialysis tubing is washed using the distilled water.
The distilled water bottle is placed back on the table.
A clamp is taken from the bench top.
The clamp is inserted on the dialysis tubing at one side.
The dialysis tubing is placed over the tissue paper on the bench top.
A 10 ml pipette is inserted to the pipette pump.
The tube labeled as IgG antibody is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and the IgG antibody in PBS buffer solution is pippeted out using 10 ml pipette.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
The dialysis tubing is taken .
filled using the IgG Antibody-PBS buffer solution.
The air present in the dialysing tube is squeezed out and the clamp is inserted.
The dialysis tubing containing the solution is placed on the tissue paper and it is wiped gently using another tissue paper.
The dialysis tubing with IgG antibody-PBS buffer solution is placed on the 0.1M sodium acetate Buffer.
The magnetic Teflon is also placed in the 0.1M sodium acetate buffer using a forceps.
The beaker containing 0.1M Sodium acetate buffer solution and dialysing tubing is taken from the bench top.
The beaker is placed on the magnetic stirrer which is placed inside the Visicooler.
The magnetic stirrer is switched on and it is kept for 3 hours at 4 degree Celsius.
After 3 hours incubation, the magnetic stirrer is switched off and the beaker containing 0.1 M sodium acetate buffer solution is taken out.
The beaker is placed back on the bench top and the dialysis tubing containing IgG antibody-PBS buffer solution is taken from the beaker.
The clamp is taken off from one side of the dialysis tubing.
The solution from the dialysis tubing is pipetted out using a Pasteur pipette.
The centrifuge tube labeled ad Dialysed Antibody is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and the dialysed IgG antibody-PBS buffer solution is added to it.
Adjust the pH of the dialysate to 4.5 using Acetic acid.
A 25ml beaker is taken from the lab table.
The dialysed solution from the tube is added to the beaker.The beaker is labeled as Dialysed Antibody.
The pH meter is switched on.The pH value is already calibrated as 7.00.
The electrode is taken out from the stand and washed with the distilled water( bottom working part).
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode (tip portion only) is dipped into the beaker containing Dialysed antibody solution. The pH value is changed to 8.00 on the display.
The electrode is taken from the beaker and is washed with distilled water.
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode is replaced into the stand. The pH value is again reached to 7.00 on the display.
A dropper is taken from the rack.
Bottle containing Acetic acid is opened. Acetic acid is taken out from the bottle using the dropper and the bottle is closed.
The acetic acid is drop wisely added to the beaker containing Dialysed antibody.
The electrode is taken out from the stand and washed with the distilled water ( bottom working part).
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode (tip portion only) is dipped into the beaker containing Dialysed antibody solution. The pH value is changed to 4.50 on the display.
The electrode is taken from the beaker and is washed with distilled water.
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode is replaced into the stand. The pH value is again reached to 7.00 on the display.
A butter paper is taken from the lab table.
The butter paper is placed on the weighing balance (mg) and it is tared.
The cap of the Pepsin bottle is opened and a little amount of Pepsin is taken using a spatula.
The Pepsin is added to the butter paper placed on the weighing balance. 4.00 mg of Pepsin is weighed.
The pepsin is added to the beaker containing dialysed antibody.
The beaker labeled as Dialysed antibody is taken from the lab table.
The content in the beaker is properly mixed by shaking.
The beaker is placed back on the table.
A piece of aluminium foil is cut from the foil roll.
The beaker is closed using the foil.
The door of the incubator is opened.
The beaker labeled as Dialysed Antibody is placed in the incubator.
The solution in the beaker is incubated for overnight at 370c.
Next day.The door of the incubator is opened.
The beaker is taken out from the incubator.
Adjust the pH of supernatant to 7.4.
The pH meter is switched on.The pH value is already calibrated as 7.00.
The electrode is taken out from the stand and washed with the distilled water( bottom working part).
78 A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode (tip portion only) is dipped into the beaker containing Dialysed antibody solution. The pH value is changed to 4.50 on the display.
The electrode is taken from the beaker and is washed with distilled water.
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode is replaced into the stand. The pH value is again reached to 7.00 on the display.
A dropper is taken from the rack and the bottle containing 1N sodium hydroxide is opened.
1N sodium hydroxide is taken out from the bottle using the dropper and the bottle is closed.
1N Sodium hydroxide is drop wisely added to the beaker containing Dialysed antibody.
The electrode is taken out from the stand and washed with the distilled water ( bottom working part).
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode (tip portion only) is dipped into the beaker containing Dialysed antibody solution. The pH value is changed to 7.40 on the display.
The electrode is taken from the beaker and is washed with distilled water.
A piece of tissue paper is taken from the box.
The electrode is wiped with tissue paper.
The electrode is replaced into the stand. The pH value is again reached to 7.00 on the display.
The beaker labeled as Dialysed antibody is taken from the lab table.
The tube labeled as Dialysate is taken from the rack.
The solution from the beaker is added into the tube.
The beaker is placed back on the rack.
The tube containing dialysate is placed on the centrifuge and is balanced by placing another tube containing water opposite to the dialysate tube.
The lid of the centrifuge is placed and is closed.
The centrifuge is adjusted to 1000g for15 minutes.
After 15 minutes, centrifuge is opened and the lid is removed
The lid is removed.
The tube labeled as Dialysate is taken from the centrifuge. A precipitate is observed in the tube.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
A 10ml pipette is taken from the rack and inserted into the pump.
The tube containing Dialysate is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and carefully pipetted out the precipitate from the tube.
The precipitate is discarded into a waste beaker.
The bottle containing distilled water is taken from the lab table.
The chromatographic column is washed with distilled water.
After proper washing, the bottle is placed back on the lab table.
The Sephacryl S-200 slurry is transferred into the column.
PBS buffer bottle is taken from the lab table.
The buffer is poured into the column.
The buffer in the column is removed into a waste beaker by removing the cap .Then the column is recapped.
The centrifuge tube containing Dialysate is taken from the rack.
The dialysate from the tube is poured into the column.
PBS buffer is taken from the bench top.
The buffer is again poured into the column.
The centrifuge tube labeled as Purified F(ab)2 fragments is taken.
The tube is placed under the chromatographic column and its cap is removed.
The cap of the column is removed.
The solution is collected in the tube. After that the column is recapped.
The centrifuge tube is then closed and placed it back on the rack.
A 1000 microlitre pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
Adjust its volume to 1000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into the pipette.
1000 microlitre of PBS buffer is pippeted out from the beaker.
A cuvette for blank (labeled as B) is taken from the rack.
1000 microlitre of PBS buffer is transferred to the cuvette.
The cuvette B is placed back on the rack.
Again 1000 microlitre of PBS buffer is taken from the beaker.
Another B labeled cuvette (for Blank) is taken from the rack.
1000 microlitre of PBS buffer is transferred to the cuvette.
The cuvette is placed back on the rack.
The lid of spectrophotometer is opened.
One of the B labeled cuvette is taken from the rack.
The cuvette is properly wiped using a tissue paper.
After that the cuvette is placed in one of the slit in the spectrophotometer.
The second cuvette labeled as B is taken from the rack.
The cuvette is wiped properly using a tissue paper.

The second cuvette is placed in the other slit in the spectrophotometer and the lid is closed.spectrophotometer starts to work on pressing the enter button.This is the graph indicating the baseline which is observed on the monitor.
The lid of the spectrophotometer is opened and one of the cuvette is taken out from it.
The cuvette labeled as B is replaced on the rack.
A 1000 microlitre pipette is taken from the stand.
Adjust its volume to 1000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into it.
The tube labeled as Purified F(ab)2 fragments is taken from the rack.
1000 microlitre of sample is pipetted out from it.
The cuvette labeled as T (Test cuvette) is taken from the rack.
The Purified F(ab)2 fragments is transferred to the cuvette.
The cuvette is wiped properly using the tissue paper.
The T labeled cuvette is placed in the spectrophotometer and is closed.The spectrophotometer starts to work on pressing the enter button.
The resultant graph is observed on the monitor.
A 10 ml pipette is taken from the stand and is inserted into a pipette pump.
The cap of the 50% glycerol bottle is opened and 5 ml of the glycerol is pippeted out.
A cryovial is taken from the cryobox.
5 ml of 50% glycerol is transferred to the cryovial.
The cryovial is replaced on the box.
A new 10ml pipette is taken from the rack and inserted into a pipette pump.
The tube containing Purified F(ab)2 fragments is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and 5 ml of Purified F(ab)2 fragments solution is pipetted out.
The tube is replaced on the rack.
The cryovial is taken from the box.
The cap of the vial is opened and pour the solution into it.
The cryovial is replaced on the cryobox.
A piece of parafilm is cut from the parafilm roll.
The outer cover is removed.
The cryovial is taken from the box.
The vial is wrapped with parafilm properly.
The wrapped cryovial which contain the sample is placed on the cryobox.
The -20 degree Freezer is opened and the cryobox with vial is kept in the freezer.
The door of the freezer is closed.
